lesson_html:
Conditionals in Python are similar to C# control flow statements, allowing you to make decisions in your code. The primary conditional statement is the 'if-elif-else' block, which is comparable to C#'s if-else statements.

Basic Conditional Syntax

if condition: # code executed if condition is True else: # code executed if condition is False

In C#, this would look like: if (condition) { // code executed if condition is true } else { // code executed if condition is false }

Multiple Conditions

Python uses 'elif' (else if) for multiple conditions, similar to C#'s 'else if':

if first_condition: # first block elif second_condition: # second block else: # final block

Logical Operators

Python uses 'and', 'or', 'not' instead of C#'s '&&', '||', '!' operators:

if x > 0 and x < 10: # checks multiple conditions if not is_valid: # negation works similarly
